Such a failure of cable management pierces my conscience like the beat of Poe's tell-tale heart, and yet I’m forever powerless – as in, I can’t be bothered – to do anything about it. Yet even I was soothed by the Steam Next Fest demo for Plug It In, a chilled-out puzzle game about clicking chunky plugs into the right outlets.
Read more
articles.title: Create cutesy fire hazards in socket management puzzler Plug It In

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
You probably still know Fullbright as the studio behind Gone Home, a delicately experimental first-person yarn about a girl exploring her family home after travelling overseas, and learning about the turmoil in her absence. Picture that game in your mind: the quietness of the hallways versus the crash of a thunderstorm outside, the sickly-sweet 90s décor, the fairy lights and screwed-up balls of paper, the gentle amber pressure of cloistered teenage memories. Now, imagine a faint scuttling behind the skirting boards. A rattling in the pipes. Was there a toilet in Gone Home's autumnal mansion? I can't recall, but you should probably steer clear.
 
Read more
articles.title: Gone Home studio Fullbright are now making games about horrible toilet spiders

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Following their remasters of Star Wars: Dark Forces and PO’ed, the sickos at Nightdive have done it again, this time with 1995 FPS Killing Time. Despite being one of the eight people in the world with a 3DO in the house, I missed this one the first time around. Let’s learn about it together. Best start with the trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Finally, GamesMaster’s second best 3DO game of 1996 gets the Nightdive treatment with Killing Time: Resurrected

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Below the thunders of the upper deep, far, far beneath in the abysmal sea, its ancient, dreamless, uninvaded sleep Subnautica 2 sleepeth - but not for too much longer, as Unknown Worlds' open world survival game is due to surface in early access form next year. In the wake of last night's trailer, store pages have gone live on Steam, Epic Games Store and Xbox, shedding a bit more light upon the aquatic monster's nature and in particular, how it will evolve before the 1.0 release.
 
Read more
articles.title: Subnautica 2 early access should last "2 to 3 years" - it'll launch with "several biomes" and "some narrative"

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Bloober Team have announced their next horror game at last night's Xbox Partner Preview showcase. It's called Cronos: The New Dawn and it's about - bear with me here - going to the past, harvesting souls, then going to the future so they can help you. It's all because you are, um, wanting to find a special rift in the future, so you can go back to a special version of the past. I think. Anyway yeah, it looks kinda fine to good.
Read more
articles.title: The Silent Hill 2 remake dev's new horror game is a time-travelling jaunt through apocalyptic Eastern Europe

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Genre tags are slippery, fickle things at the best of times, but I feel like each one I use to label Dunebound Tactics almost diminishes it, as I’m sacrificing something precious for the sake of powering on through the arid sands of easily comestible, digestible, poop-estible online content. Ah well, circle of life and all that. Plus, at least it’s thematic: you’ll have to make sacrifices yourself if you want to progress across its unforgiving deserts. This one’s got shades of roguelite, RPG, strategy, and turn-based tactics. Nothing too uncommon, but it’s the shades of Red Faction, Frostpunk, and Sunless Sea that have me interested.
Read more
articles.title: Dunebound Tactics brings terrain manipulation to a strategy RPG where you can sacrifice companions to power your ship

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Alan Wake developers Remedy have announced their very first multiplayer game, a three-person co-op shooter set in the world of Control and thereby, the Remedy Connected Universe. Previously codenamed Condor, it's called FBC: Firebreak - and I am going to immediately recommend they shorten it to Firebreak, because that caps-into-colon combo is going to wind me up when I'm writing news posts at speed. While I'm throwing my weight around, let me also instantly rebut the pedants who are even now racing to leave a comment saying that, actually, Remedy did work on Smilegate's multiplayer shooter CrossfireX. Yes, they did, but only the single player bits. 


Anyway, Firebreak! Here's the announcement trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Remedy unveil wacky co-op shooter FBC: Firebreak, set in the Control universe

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Remedy have released the first proper in-game trailer for Alan Wake 2's second expansion, The Lake House. It's billed as even more of a horror experience than the base game, and takes place in a research facility run by the Lynchian ghostbuster organisation you may have encountered in Remedy's paranormal shooter Control. As such, the expansion forms a direct connection between the games, and may - read: definitely will - harbour a few clues about the story of the forthcoming Control 2.
 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 Lake House expansion trailer hints at Control 2 overlap, also features ghastly paint monsters

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Developers Unknown Worlds and publishers Krafton have given us our first proper look at their next open world exploration sim, Subnautica 2, which will launch on PC via Xbox Game Preview in 2025. It's also coming to Steam and the Epic Games Store. It'll support four player co-op, alongside the returning singleplayer survive-o-buildy experience, and it'll take place on a brand new planet. Here's the reveal trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Subnautica 2 is coming in 2025 with four player co-op - here's the announcement trailer

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Bohemia Interactive have announced that Arma 4, the next big instalment in their shooter simulation series, will release in 2027. The announcement came at the tail-end of Bohemia's 25th Anniversary Concert, alongside some disturbingly gun-less footage of a coastal promontory with rippling ocean waters against a cloudy sky - it reminds me more of The Elder Scrolls 6's announcement teaser than any tactical mili-banger. Perhaps they're secretly making an open world walking simulator? I kid, I kid. Please put the chair down.
 Read more
articles.title: Arma 4 will release in 2027

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Back in 2021, that dark epoch known as the Pre-Edwin Age, there was but one Ed at Rock Paper Shotgun - the venerable Ed Thorn, aka Edders. Edders had a dream, the dream of Halo Infinite getting a battle royale mode. Like Moses descending from the mount with a Needler in either hand, he bedazzled and amazed us with visions of "an enormous playground stitched together from some of Halo's most iconic maps of yore; Warthogs and Mongooses roaming the lands; players racing to the M41 SPNKR as it spawns; grappling to a rooftop and laying down covering fire; some contrived reason as to why there's a circle of poison gas closing in... but hey, rings are what Halo does best, right? It's 100% doable."
Ed Thorn has always been a journalist of great sagacity and supernatural insight, so it was of no surprise to the RPS editors of the era when rumours bubbled up a few months later that Certain Affinity had partnered with 343 Industries (nowadays Halo Studios) to make Halo battle royale a reality. These rumours have now been confirmed by Certain Affinity's former design director Mike Clopper, who says the now-cancelled mode could have been a "game changer".
 Read more
articles.title: Halo's battle royale mode "could have been a game changer", says former Infinite dev, and you know what, I'll buy it

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Ever been in a position where two people are really going at each other, hurling pointed jabs and insults back and forth, and you're stuck in the middle? Well then, perhaps you'll empathise with the enemies in Archons, a twin-stick Vampire Survivors-like where you control two characters at once, and attacks bounce between them automatically as they move about the arena. I gave the Steam Next Fest demo a quick whirl today, and after a couple of swift attempts (I died horribly fast), I realised this could become a bit of a danger to my free time, so I've put it away for now.
Read more
articles.title: Archons doubles the chaos of Vampire Survivors by giving you two characters to control at once

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Nepos Games are the two-person studio behind Nebuchadnezzar, which Nate Crowley called "two thirds of an outstanding historical city builder". They've just informed me they're making a new building sim called County Of Fortune, out in Q4 2025. It ain't a city builder, though. In fact, it claims to have murdered the city builder in cold blood, which is unfortunate, because I was really looking forward to a round of Manor Lords later. 


"The city-builder is dead, long live the county-builder," declares the press release, brandishing the husk of SimCity over its head. OK, I'll bite - what's a county-builder then? Well, it's sort of several city-builders having an argument. In County Of Fortune, you seed and grow a number of settlements side by side, then manage their economic and social relations. In other words, it's a game that appears to simulate the phenomenon of culture clash. I'm not sure all this amounts to the wholesale death of a genre, but it's certainly intriguing. Here's the Steam page, and here's a trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: In medieval strategy sim County Of Fortune you run a whole county's worth of quarrelling towns

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Praise the gods, it's Hades 2 update day, and developers Supergiant are not mucking about. They have bolstered the nippy roguelike with a heap of shiny new things in this "Olympian Update", including a new weapon with homing attacks, a liver-pecking boss fight, two new animal familiars, and the home region of the Gods - mount Olympus. It's probably the biggest update they've made yet in terms of fresh sights. And by "fresh sights", I mean Dionysus sporting a leopard-print thong. Yikes.
Read more
articles.title: Hades 2 adds a boss fight against Prometheus and a lot more in a chunky update

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
In a recent chat with the Ian Games Network, IO Interactive boss Hakan Abrak said the Hitman developer "absolutely feel(s) like 20 plus years of training for the agent fantasy, creating an agent that travels the world and globetrotting whatnot, has given us some know-how" on bringing James Bond to the greasy screen ("greasy screen" is my new attempt at coining a "the big/small screen" but for games. I foresee big success.)
Abrak is so confident, in fact, that he reckons their Bond project might end up mirroring the World Of Assassination’s trilogy format. "But what's exciting about that project is that we actually got to do an original story,” Abrak says. “So it's not a gamification of a movie. It's completely beginning and becoming a story, hopefully for a big trilogy out there in the future."
It’s a fine interview, worth a read. But I must ask: how are the queues, Abrak? How am I supposed to get excited about a new IO game if you don’t mention the queues? 
Read more
articles.title: IO Interactive fail to mention if a potential Project 007 “trilogy” will feature Hitman’s glorious queues, so who’s to say whether it’s worth my time

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Leadership at Don’t Nod yesterday “presented a reorganisation project to the employee representative bodies,” via financials report, in response to "a balance sheet that highlights the need to secure the company's resources" following the underperformance of Jusant and Banishers: Ghosts of new Eden.
In plain terms, this means that up to 69 workers at the French company are at risk of layoffs due to an 11% year-on-year decline in operating revenue, via IGN. The number represents "29% of the Paris studio workforce", say the STJV.
Read more
articles.title: Leadership at Don’t Nod are "creating an atmosphere of extreme violence” with planned layoffs, says French game workers union

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
I punched a cultist in the face in Streets Of Rogue 2, just because. He started running away - something I would not allow. When another robed cultist spotted what was happening, he tried to intervene, and a kind of Benny Hill pursuit chain began. We ran across a beach, through public toilets, and into the surf. In the end I had to knock them both out. As they lay unconscious, I worried they might soon wake and tell someone what I had done. This can't happen, I hate accountability. I punched their unawake bodies toward the sea in an effort to float the evidence away. But after a few punches the first man exploded into chunks of flesh. I am a murderer now. I was supposed to be a chef.
Streets Of Rogue 2 has a demo out for Steam Next Fest, and while a lot of features are locked up behind the word "UNAVAILABLE" in red font, there's still quite a lot of mischief for you to get up to.
Read more
articles.title: The demo for Streets Of Rogue 2 lets you roleplay as the world's most violent chef

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Archetype Entertainment and Blur Studio's space RPG Exodus was announced back in December, and was broadly notable for a couple of things: 1) Matthew McConaughey plays a character, and 2) the game's story is woven around time dilation during faster than light travel, with star-hopping adventurers prosecuting a fight against evil Celestials over hundreds, perhaps thousands of years.
Now, it is notable for three things, the third thing being a cosmic blubber-spire of gurning faces who want to eat your ship and soul. Say hello to the Mara Yama, the ickiest Celestial faction so far. Here's a trailer, in which McConaughey does that thing where he lingers on the sibilants and makes you want to lean in and vigorously mess up his hair.
 Read more
articles.title: New trailer for Mass Effect wannabe Exodus features space-capable flesh cathedral whisperingly described by Matthew McConaughey

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The existence of Knights In Tight Spaces, sequel to Fights In Tight Spaces, implies the existence of an unknown quantity or perhaps, an infinity of follow-up games that rhyme with both of those. Frights In Tight Spaces is the obvious horror spin-off. Sleights In Tight Spaces would be an urban pick-pocketing sim. Fights In Trite Spaces is about arguing with people on social media. Ah, you could spend a whole article, indeed, a series of articles, just fleshing out the iterations. Fortunately, Knights In Tight Spaces has a new demo to distract me.
 
Read more
articles.title: Knights In Tight Spaces kicks the Tight Fight formula in the direction of fantasy role-playing

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Ah, what a pickle I’ve gotten myself into. I need to climb down from this table if I’m ever going to meet up with my teammates and finish the game, but the stupid zombies cannot get me if I stay up here. It’s an absolute gherkin, I tell you. A real cornichonundrum.
The steel pipe in my right hand is doing a decent job of whittling them down, and the torch in my left lets me see the expressions of impotent rage on their flaky faces. Still, the pipe won’t last forever - this is videogame steel, the crumbliest steel there is. Thank god No More Room In Hell 2 doesn’t bother with the hunger or rest parts of the survival equation. I can, in theory, stay on this table forever.
Read more
articles.title: No More Room In Hell 2 nails the terror of being isolated in a zombie outbreak, although you can just hide on a table if you want

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Twitch have temporarily banned an account run by streamer Asmongold, otherwise known as Zack Hoyt, after he expressed genocidal sentiments about Israel's killing of Palestinian people in Gaza. According to the eSports journalist Rod Breslau, he's been sent to the naughty step for a grand total of two weeks, which I'm sure will be a huge inconvenience and will really teach him the error of his ways. Assuming Breslau's sources are accurate, it's a great demonstration of Twitch's tolerance for streamers with big audiences, the kind of slap on the wrist you'd expect from a platform that recently reinstated Donald Trump's account after banning him in 2021 for the charge of inciting an insurrection.
 Read more
articles.title: Twitch gives streamer a reported 14-day ban for saying he's OK with the genocide of Palestinians

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Back in September, open world publisher Ubisoft put out a 3-days-weekly return to office mandate for their entire staff worldwide - a decision that French Video Game Workers Union (STJV) said was "made without any tangible justification or any consultation with the workers’ representatives". In response, the STJV called on staff in France to hold a three-day strike beginning yesterday, which the union reports to be underway with the participation of more than 700 workers, via Le Monde.
"This decision is announced immediately after the failure of the profit-sharing negotiations," STJV wrote at the time. “Exactly like previous salary negociations: management’s proposals were inacceptable, the negotiations’ timetable was appalling, and management was deaf to the proposals of the various Employee representatives."
 
Read more
articles.title: 700 Ubisoft staff in France hold strikes in response to worldwide return to office mandate from Assassin’s Creed publisher

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
"Do you have a ping of 1000 or something," my opponent asked, during my inaugural bout of Straftat. Ah yes, this is it, that sense of unpleasantly intimate sheepishness. That's the withering late-90s chatbox scorn I've been missing, in this age of glossy live service multiplayer. I hid under a stairwell in order to meditate upon my response, then laboriously typed: "No, I just suck." Right on cue, the other player tumbled into view and shredded me with an AK.
The player I met in my second match was more forgiving. "I honestly think the characters need more HP," they said, generously. My wrists need more HP, actually. My eyes and reflexes need urgent patching.
 
Read more
articles.title: I hope Straftat is 2024's breakout shooter, because the demo's 25 maps are gloriously unwholesome

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’ve never learnt to drive, and while I’ve always told myself it’s impractical - unnecessary, expensive, potentially dangerous for someone with undiagnosed but, I suspect, incredibly likely dyspraxia - I’m not sure it’ll ever stop being one of those quiet regrets; the ambient type that don’t really bubble to the surface much unless I’m watching a Noah Gervais road trip video, but just float there and make my mood like, 1.5% worse at all times.
So maybe it’s just me, but there’s a sense of intense freedom and adventure to Keep Driving's Steam demo that belies its prosaic, tractor-tailing subject matter. The opening minutes are oddly silent, until Westkust’s Swirl blasts out from your radio as soon as you drive off toward your first destination - your mate’s house, to hang out and play console games. It comes on strong and sweet; a rush of wind through an open window on a warm morning.
Read more
articles.title: Keep Driving made me nostalgic for road trips I’ve never been on and places I’ve never seen

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Riot Games are cutting more jobs at their studios, the company announced today. This is the second time in a year the League of Legends developer has laid off workers. Chairman and co-founder of Riot, Marc Merrill, made the announcement yesterday, claiming that by cutting these jobs the company was "evolving League" and "investing heavily in solving today’s challenges". A total of 32 people have lost their jobs, mostly workers on League of Legends, according to a figure the developer gave to our sister site Eurogamer.
Read more
articles.title: Riot lay off more workers for the second time in a year - and add "evolving" to our big list of nonsense words companies use to describe job cuts

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
You might have caught this one during Day Of The Devs earlier this year. It’s stuck with me since because the developer Tanat seemed like a rad dude, and also because there’s nothing I cherish more than taking a bad pun and just absolutely going to town on it, marrow and all. Building Relationships is about buildings forming relationships in a Love Islandy scenario, though without the reality TV framing you might find in say, Crush House. But the real gag here is the commitment to the bit. Besides that, it’s just a really charming and fun N64-style 3D platformer.
It also features the sort wonky physics that definitely wouldn’t get Ninty’s seal of quality, but work brilliantly here, especially since your character consists largely of angles but still insists on, you know, performing motions.
Read more
articles.title: I am happy to report that Building Relationships has more than one joke, and most of them are pretty good

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In the grim darkness of the far future, you will not have to worry about getting preyed upon by rival Space Marine chapters whilst duffing up the Tyranids, for there are no plans to add a PvPvE mode to Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. That's according to game director Dmitry Grigorenko, who observes that enjoyable PvPvE is the "holy grail" of game design, much-sought and seldom claimed. Balancing shooters in which players fight both each other and the bots is tricky, especially in a game as prone to dousing the screen in giblets as Space Marine 2. 

 
Read more
articles.title: No plans for a Space Marine 2 PvPvE mode - "it sounds great on paper", but "it's very annoying" in practice

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The allure of the sea-green GameBoy screen is difficult to resist. Picking up from where Pokémon left off two decades ago, Letalis is a bleepy-bloopy retro RPG about wandering from town to town and doing battle with dodgy local leaders to prove your worth. But you won't be doing the fighting yourself, God no. Leave that to the squad of Roman gladiators hiding in your back pocket. 
Read more
articles.title: Letalis is Pokémon for GameBoy except you're battling with Roman gladiators

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
My name is Edwinus Evans Thirlwellus, Commander of the News Writers of the North, General of a small lonely box of unpainted Warhammer 40,000 Orc figures I was given for my 21st birthday, and loyal servant to the true emperor, Timmy Mallett. FATHER TO NO MURDERED SONS. HUSBAND OF NO MURDERED WIVES. OWNER OF A BRONZE SWIMMING CERTIFICATE AND A WHITE BELT IN KARATE. Eater of pizza that has fallen on the floor, like a whole minute ago! And I will have my vengeance, in this life or the next. Hah, it's much easier to make that last claim in a video game, rather than when standing in a literal circle of swords. The game in question is Dieseldome: Oil And Blood, and it is pretty good fun. There's a demo on Steam, for now is the time of Next Fest.
 
Read more
articles.title: Blood-crazed arena FPS Dieseldome takes DOOM Eternal and rams it into Gladiator

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
If you've read any of my stuff by now, you'd know that I am a simple man who enjoys violence in his games. No story? Absolutely fine by me - cuts the faff. This is why I like the demo for first-person shooter Cop Bastard a lot. It's set in early 90s Japan, where you'll smoke fools with guns in straightforward homage to 90s action movies. And it has an updated demo - not officially part of the latest Steam Next Fest - out right now.
Read more
articles.title: Cop Bastard channels John Woo for some perfectly punchy FPSing

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Last October, Paradox Interactive announced that they and development studio Harebrained Schemes were breaking up, following underwhelming sales of Harebrained's 1930s-set XCOMlike, The Lamplighters League. The publishers had already made layoffs at Harebrained in the run-up to release, implying that preorder numbers were low; ultimately, Paradox wrote it off as a $22 million flop. At the time of the "parting of ways", Paradox chief operational officer Charlotta Nilsson washed her hands of XCOMlikes entirely, commenting that "a new project or sequel in the same genre was not in line with our portfolio plans". 
 
Read more
articles.title: Paradox think there's no point competing with XCOM after their Lamplighters flop - it's "winner takes all" in the "tactical gaming space"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The developer of Full Fathom describes it as a "thalassophobia sim". You are the lone engineer on a rustbucket submarine exploring the dangerous waters of a submerged country in an alternate reality 1990s. The warning lights on the control panel are flashing, a buzzer is spluttering like a dying bluebottle, and your robotic assistant is about as useful as an umbrella in the Mariana Trench. Things could not get any worse. And then you see it. Something in the green haze outside. Something with a tail.
Read more
articles.title: I have embraced the subaquatic dread of not knowing which button to press in Full Fathom

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
How do official Bethesda bug compilation videos coinciding with a game's launch sound? Or at least, a proper list of known bugs on day one, to preempt any compilations created by vengeful players? Skyrim Lead Designer and Starfield Systems Designer Bruce Nesmith has spoken a little about the “interesting problem” of how open developers should be about technical issues on day one, given the expectation some players have that every game should be "flawless".
When asked by Videogamer if lists of known bugs (Nesmith throws out ‘700’ as an example for Skyrim) should be shared with fans on launch "to temper expectations," he responded:
Read more
articles.title: Should devs tell people about launch bugs in advance? “It’s an interesting problem” says Starfield and Skyrim designer

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
If I could extend my arm forty times its normal length, while also granting it the flexibility of a sock filled with mince, I’d probably just use it to take the bins out without leaving my chair. But what if someone were to use this power... for evil? That’s the gist of My Arms Are Longer Now, a cartoony "stealth-comedy" game about worming a single stretchy limb into people’s valuables, which has a Steam Next Fest demo out now.
Read more
articles.title: My Arms Are Longer Now is a thievery game where the thief is a stretchy boneless flesh tube

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
My earliest memory of the Commandos series of tactical stealth games was my dad bringing home a box copy of the original. “The missions take months. Months!” his mate had told him. Get less shit mates, thought I, for I had already played it elsewhere, and knew that the missions took mere minutes if you put the game on easy then rushed your objectives, bonking nazis along the way. I did not rush the new Steam demo for Kalypso’s revival, Commandos: Origins, but it’s still doable inside half an hour. I had expected a little more, but what’s here has certainly given me some optimism that the full game might well be worth sinking - if not months - at least more time than it takes to wildly lunge at a few nazis en route to your objective.
Read more
articles.title: Commandos Origins looks like a solid and satisfying return for the legendary tactics series

articles.author: Robert Anderson
articles.description:
Looking for a new gaming monitor? I don’t mean to tempt you, but this is one hell of a deal. Beating its most recent Black Friday pricing ($1179) by over $200, the Samsung 49" Odyssey G93SC Series OLED Curved Gaming Monitor is now down to $949 at Amazon. That’s $650 off its original list price, and one of the best deals of the year so far.
 Read more
articles.title: Amazon knocks $650 off the Samsung 49" Odyssey G9 OLED curved gaming monitor

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Cast your mind back ten years. Done? Good, you survived the hideous form of time travel known as long-term memory. Now, do you see a horrendous first-person shooter anywhere back there, full of memes and intentionally terrible font choices? Congratulations, you may have remembered 420BlazeIt, a freakish eyesore of a game developed during a 7-day game jam by one of the people behind Crossy Road, of all things. It briefly did the YouTuber rounds, back when YouTube was not yet the anxiety-inducing ad factory it is today. 
Now I'm going to ask you to come back to the present. But prepare for a bit of a shock - there's a sequel coming to that bong huffing shooter. 420BlazeIt 2 has been announced for some months, but now there's a demo you can play too.
Read more
articles.title: The most obnoxious shooter you vaguely remember has returned in 420BlazeIt 2

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Space whale city builder Beyond These Stars has been delayed till 2025, developers Balancing Monkey Games have announced, for there are too many monkeys to balance, and too many astral cetaceans to wrangle before the early access launch. I react to this news with mingled happiness and disappointment. Disappointment at the delay, and happiness, because I hadn't heard of Beyond These Stars before. To coincide with the delay announcement they've released a new trailer, below, which talks us through the business of foraging on passing planets. It looks engrossing.
 Read more
articles.title: Space whale city builder Beyond These Stars now lets you visit planets, but not in a colonial way

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Neva is the Sophomore effort from Nomada Studio, who you may remember from their beautiful, dreamy platformer Gris. Neva is not a literal sequel to Gris, but it certainly seems to be one in a spiritual sense, as it, too, is a floaty hand-illustrated platformer fond of metaphor. Neva introduces some drama, with combat and a health system (if not actual stakes because of near-instant restarts), and although neither the platforming nor combat are precise enough to be neat bedfellows, I think we should be willing to forgive most of the mess.
Read more
articles.title: Neva review: a Ghibli-esque platformer with tight visuals and loose combat

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Sektori promises to "transport you into another state of consciousness", but what the pulsing soundtrack initially did was transport me to Youtube so I could look up this scene from Spaced, where Michael Smiley raves out to a boiling kettle. By elegant coincidence, that video is about the length of my longest run so far in Sektori's demo - a very busy 60 seconds or so.
Read more
articles.title: Geometry Wars and techno live on in Sektori's demo, but you probably won't for long

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Credit where it’s due to Silent Sadie, whose Steam Next Fest demo is out now: even within the confines of a 2.5D platformer, I don’t think it could lean any harder into its love of pratfallin’, piano-tinklin’ 1920s comedy cinema.
Read more
articles.title: Buster Keatoncore platformer Silent Sadie harkens back to the roaring, jumping, sliding twenties

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Both part of Italy’s "not very big" developer community, Morbidware’s Diego Sacchetti and Misbug have known each other for a long time, but hadn’t had the chance to collaborate together until 2019’s The Textorcist: The Story of Ray Bibbia - a bullet hell where you dodge projectiles and type in exorcisms to banish demons. They worked well together, so started looking for their next project - something full-time that could take the place of the increasing instability of freelancing.
It was a shared passion away from videogames that ended up moulding the shape that project would take. "We love tabletop RPGs," says designer and programmer Sacchetti. "So when we stumbled into Mörk Borg, and then we started to play, we looked at each other in the eyes and said, 'Why don't we make a game out of it?'"
Read more
articles.title: Mörk Borg Heresy Supreme’s Morbidware on making failure fun, even when you’re cursed to wander the land as a goblin

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
One of the most important lessons in skiing is, presumably, to look where you're going. You wouldn't want to ski with your eyes closed or while viewing yourself from a drone pointed back at the mountain from above. That'd be daft.

Or maybe not. Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders is the frosty followup to the mountain biking original, Lonely Mountains: Downhill, and like its predecessor it's about going fast while barely able to see what's coming. Yet also like its predecessor, initial frustrations melted away until I was eagerly hitting the slopes in the Snow Riders demo for just one more quick go.

 
Read more
articles.title: Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders is a slick ski 'em up, if its demo is any indication

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Normal games for normal people, that's what everyone loves. Cosy experiences where nothing goes wrong and you have absolutely zero things to investigate and no otherworldly mysteries to worry about. It may shock you to learn that we were recently duped by "normal" gardening sim Grunn, which was not normal at all. But don't worry, it won't happen again. Today we bring you the ordinary and not-one-bit-suspicious Trip, which sees players wandering from carriage to carriage, chatting pleasantly with passengers during a long train journey. How long? Let me look at the timetable here, let's see... "Forever," it says. Hm. Must be a misprint.
Read more
articles.title: Trip is a pleasant train journey with normal folk, like this unblinking child who speaks only in dark symbols

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
What is the cutest type of eyeball? This question has plagued the games industry since Nintendo first allowed millions of unsupervised children to play god with Mii avatars and their customisable peepers. In low-stakes fishing game Webfishing, you can give your fuzzy avatar one of 33 styles of eye (I counted). This is the mark of a solid Animal Crossing-like. There's a lot of other character creation bits and bobs, of course, but you'll have to catch a bunch of bass and sell the haul to unlock every boopable nose and bleppy smile.
Read more
articles.title: Fishing games don't come much cuter than the Animal Crossing style island of Webfishing

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Write travel journalism to imaginary places, my spaghetti once spelled out. Do package holidays count? In Nahantu’s jungles, I linger to take shots of vines spilling from verdigris-kissed cages, of footfall-slicked stone paths and mesoamerican mosaics. Even Vessel Of Hatred’s malignancy feels like a grimly gorgeous tourist trap. Trip Advisor-recommended cyclopean polyps. TikTok viral demonic cysts. I’ve even got a leopard cub to pose with. He’s not sedated, promise. He’s just like that. I told him how much the ultimate edition costs and he’s been catatonic ever since.
I’d like to stick around, but I keep getting ushered along to the next leg of the tour. There are mobs to pop into goo like ripe spots, each fight as slick and frictionless as a pygmy hippo in a butter bath. There are a dozen different tiered resources and event types designed to make repetition feel like progress, until hell freezes over then melts again. It’s fine, Blizzard packed me some wellies. It’s all so comfortable I suspect they’d have thrown in some Xanax and a back rub if they could.
 
Read more
articles.title: Diablo 4: Vessel Of Hatred review: mildly pleasant clicking in very pretty jungles

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Sometimes, a game needs an original premise before I'll write it up, and sometimes, it just needs a flying car, or a slick revolver with chambers outlined in mouthwatering red neon. Say hello to ExeKiller, which I am filing under "not new, but news to me". I know, "ExeKiller" sounds like a computer virus, though I think the people who make viruses tend to favour less obviously nefarious names, like "Microsoft Werd". Hang on, that's what I'm writing this article with! Quickly, before I lose this PC to ransomware: ExeKiller is actually a "semi-open" world cyber-Western FPS with retro futurist visuals. It casts you as a bounty hunter plying the dunes and gas stations of a post-apocalyptic Earth, and it looks like a mix of Cyberpunk 2077 and Drive. Here's some pre-alpha footage.
 
Read more
articles.title: Semi-open world FPS ExeKiller is a mix of cyberpunk and Wild West with a 1970s-style hovercar

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I loved the original Until Dawn - a spruced-up horror take on those old FMV adventure games, with just the right mix of B-movie self awareness and creature feature scares. I was very close to buying the recent remake, actually, until I watched the extended prank scene online and realized, oh no, they’re taking themselves seriously now. They prestige-ified it. It insisted upon itself, Louis, so I didn’t bother. I still wouldn’t say no to a sequel though, and based on a couple of (admittedly vague) hints from two of the game’s actors, one might already be in the works.
Read more
articles.title: Until Dawn actors hint at a sequel, but there's reason to be sceptical

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Intel s uvedením nové procesorové generace Arrow Lake nejspíš zažije podobné kontroverze jako před necelými třemi lety s Alder Lake. Testeři jsou rozladěni a výsledky nebudou měsíc po testu nic moc vypovídat.
articles.title: Fenomén CPU Intel: výsledky testů značně různé, v čase nárůst výkonu i o desítky procent, Arrow Lake je tu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Prozkoumáme, jaký vliv mají hyperparametry modelů MLPRegressor i MLPClassifier na kvalitu natrénované neuronové sítě. Budeme přitom sledovat interní stav velmi jednoduché sítě s pouhými třemi neurony.
articles.title: Neuronové sítě v knihovně scikit-learn: dokončení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Představíme si nástroj pro správu clusterů Kubernetes, jeden hudební přehrávač, vyzkoušíme neoficiální obchod s aplikacemi pro Raspberry Pi a řekneme si o nástroji pro snadnou úpravu textu v příkazové řádce.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (23. 10. 2024): spravujte své clustery Kubernetes

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V neděli 13. října proběhl druhý den letošní konference LinuxDays. Mluvilo se o IPv6, adresaci uvnitř Kuberenetes, meshové síti Meshtastic, penetračních testech serverů a informačních systémech v dopravě.
articles.title: IPv6 v infrastruktuře, síť Meshtastic a serverová bezpečnost na LinuxDays

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Po zvukové kartě AdLib s čipem OPL2 se pro platformu PC začaly vydávat i další zvukové karty. Ty přinesly možnost přehrávání zvuků přes D/A převodník, mnohé taktéž měly A/D převodník (nahrávání).
articles.title: Vývoj zvukových karet pro platformu IBM PC po vydání karty AdLib

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Letošní OpenAlt nabídne přibližně 50 přednášek a workshopů rozdělených do pěti tematických tracků. Čekají vás přednášky, workshopy, bohatý doprovodný program a řada novinek připravených pro letošní ročník.
articles.title: Program pro OpenAlt je připraven, přijeďte 2. a 3. listopadu do Brna

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Přečteme si, jak se dá zneužít Zero-Day zranitelnost, jaký problém může způsobit neaktualizovaný Firefox, jak policie chytá kyberlumpy, o škodlivých aplikacích na Google Play nebo komu unikla data.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: nula sem, nula tam aneb zranitelnost nultého dne

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Firma Huawei je připravena oficiálně vydat open-source operační systém HarmonyOS NEXT. Ubuntu 25.04 ponese kódové jméno „Plucky Puffin“. Společnost Google pracuje na nativní aplikaci Linux Terminal pro systém Android.
articles.title: Huawei chystá HarmonyOS NEXT, Ubuntu 25.04 bude Plucky Puffin

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: AMD ROCm brzy s OpenCL 3.0, vychází Ardour 8.10 a Wine 9.20 vylepšuje integraci s GitLabem, Valve přispívá ovladačem OpenVR do projektu SDL, problémy KDE na specifickém hardwaru vyřeší Plasma 6.2.2.
articles.title: Intel pracuje na podpoře Coreboot pro Xeony 6, starší Ryzeny dostanou opravu IBPB nejen pro Retbleed

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Proplulo to před dvěma týdny internetem: Pink Floydi, jako další z legend, prodali svůj hudební katalog společnosti Sony Music za 400 miliónů dolarů. Co ale bude se všemi těmi alby, koncerty a poslechovými reakcemi na YouTube?
articles.title: Sony skupuje legendy: Pink Floyd prodali katalog za 400 miliónů dolarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Architektura i386 je již dávno zastaralá a většina distribucí už ji opustila. Nyní se k nim přidává i Kali Linux, což je specializovaná linuxová distribuce zaměřená pro penetrační testování a etické hackování. Vývojáři Kali se nyní rozhodli ukončit podporu pro 32bitovou architekturu x86.
articles.title: Kali Linux končí s podporou 32bitové architektury x86

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Prohlížeč Vivaldi vyšel ve verzi 7.0, která přináší zcela přepracované uživatelské rozhraní s plovoucími kartami, novými elegantními ikonami a přizpůsobitelným hlavním panelem. Nový dashboard soustřeďuje všechny nástroje do jednoho praktického prostoru.
articles.title: Vivaldi 7.0 přináší přepracované rozhraní s plovoucími kartami

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Soukromé rádio OFF Radio Kraków kvůli malé sledovanosti propustilo před několika měsíci své hlasatele. Od úterý rádio znova vysílá, hlasatelé jsou ale tři AI. Jsou to Jakub Zieliński (22 let, student akustického inženýrství), Emilia Nowak (20 let, studentka žurnalistiky) a Alex Szulc (23 let, student psychologie).
articles.title: OFF Radio Kraków propustilo hlasatele a vysílá s AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Fortinet ve středu zveřejnil detaily závažné zranitelnosti CVE-2024–47575 (CWE-306) ve FortiManageru.  Chyba je přezdívaná FortiJump. Vzdálený neautentizovaný útočník může spustit libovolný kód. Uživatelé by měli aktualizovat na verze 7.6.1, 7.4.5, 7.2.8, 7.0.13, 6.4.15 a 6.2.13.
articles.title: FortiManager má závažnou bezpečnostní chybu, aktualizujte

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jak jsme již informovali, Greg Kroah-Hartman minulý pátek odstranil ze souboru MAINTAINERS několik ruských vývojářů s krátkým odůvodněním: „Odstranění…
articles.title: Vývojáři odstraněni ze souboru MAINTAINERS v jádře kvůli sankcím proti Rusku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Společnost JetBrains uvolnila pro nekomerční použití svá dvě IDE: WebStorm zaměřený na vývoj webů a Rider pro C# a .NET. Pokud tato IDE používáte k nekomerčním účelům, jako je učení, vývoj projektů s otevřeným zdrojovým kódem, tvorba obsahu nebo hobby vývoj, můžete je nyní používat zdarma.
articles.title: JetBrains WebStorm a Rider jsou pro nekomerční použití zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V červnu Raspberry Pi oznámilo AI Kit s výkonem 13 TOPS, tedy Tera Operations per Second (1012). Nyní přichází jeho nástupce s názvem AI HAT+, který dosahuje dvojnásobného výkonu 26 TOPS.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi má nový AI HAT+ s výkonem až 26 TOPS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: V najnovšej verzii programovacieho jazyka Go bol do štandardnej knižnice pridaný balíček iter, ktorý umožňuje vytvárať vlastné iterátory. V rámci týchto zmien boli pridané nové funkcie do balíčkov maps a slices. Balíček slices má tieto nové funkcie:
articles.title: Go 1.23 pridáva nové funkcie pre výrezy a mapy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: radekm)
articles.description: Nově vydaný velký jazykový model Claude 3.5 Sonnet umožňuje ovládat aplikace v počítači. Funkcionalita se jmenuje computer use a je v betaverzi.
articles.title: Jazykový model Claude umí nově ovládat počítač

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: PeoplePath)
articles.description: Společnost PeoplePath pořádá v Plzni jednou za dva měsíce workshopy na různá IT témata. Tentokrát bylo téma Enterprise PHP - Příběh jedné velmi staré PHP aplikace a byl pořízen videozáznam.
articles.title: Video z workshopu Enterprise PHP

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: O knihovně Rustls se původně mluvilo jako o moderní knihovně TLS napsané v programovacím jazyce Rust, která zaručuje paměťovou bezpečnost. Kromě bezpečnostních výhod, které z toho plynou, nyní knihovna dosáhla i toho, že je rychlejší než OpenSSL i BoringSSL.
articles.title: Rustls svým výkonem překonává OpenSSL a BoringSSL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Arm ruší licenci Qualcommu, což je pokračování boje, který začal koncem roku 2022. Tehdy Arm zažaloval firmu Qualcomm kvůli akvizici společnosti Nuvia v roce 2021. Společnost Arm totiž tvrdila, že akvizice Nuvie způsobila porušení licence společnosti Arm a požadovala, aby společnosti Qualcomm a Nuvia zničily veškeré návrhy, které společnost Nuvia vytvořila před akvizicí.
articles.title: Arm ruší licenci společnosti Qualcomm

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Představenstvo Sanfranciské městské dopravní agentury (SFMTA) souhlasilo, že vynaloží 212 milionů dolarů na to, aby se rychlodráha Muni Metro zbavila závislosti na disketách. Systém automatického řízení vlaků (ATCS) Muni Metra vyžaduje 5,25" diskety od roku 1998, kdy byl instalován na stanici metra Market Street v San Franciscu. Systém používá tři diskety pro nahrání softwaru DOS, který řídí centrální servery systému.
articles.title: San Francisco chce metro zbavit závislosti na 5,25" disketách

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 14.0 prohlížeče Tor zaměřeného na ochranu soukromí. Jedná se o první stabilní vydání založené na Firefoxu 128 ESR, které zahrnuje změny za celý rok dodané do Firefoxu. Byl také dokončen každoroční audit přechodu na ESR, při kterém vývojáři zkontrolovali a vyřešili více než 200 problémů hlášených v Bugzille týkajících se změn ve Firefoxu, které mohou negativně ovlivnit soukromí a bezpečnost uživatelů prohlížeče Tor Browser. Závěrečné zprávy z tohoto auditu jsou nyní k dispozici v repozitáři tor-browser-spec v projektové instanci GitLabu.
articles.title: Tor Browser 14.0 přechází na Firefox 128 ESR a prodlužuje podporu některých platforem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Anthony Stalker)
articles.description: Společnost SUSE Linux bude mít dveře otevřené linuxové komunitě a všem přátelům open source. SUSE Linux vyvíjí komerční Linux, Rancher a další kontejnerizační řešení.
articles.title: SUSE Linux zve na den otevřených dveří 13. listopadu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Intel v předstihu posílá do vývojové větve jádra patche vylepšující podporu zejména u jeho integrovaných grafických jader. Už jsme psali o přípravách na generaci Xe3 či dalších PCI ID z rodiny Arrow Lake, nyní je na řadě třeba platforma Haswell z roku 2014.
articles.title: Intel pro Linux 6.13: Protected Xe Path i patche pro stařičká iGPU Haswell či 865G

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Kankys)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 21. listopadu 2024 bychom se měli dočkat nové verze PHP s označením 8.4. Mezi novinkami najdeme například: vylepšený výkon, nové zlepšení syntaxe či vylepšené vyřizování chyb a mnoho dalšího. I přes své stáří se PHP stále těší velké oblibě u mnoha vývojářů pro všechny své výhody.
articles.title: PHP 8.4 by mělo vyjít 21. listopadu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dosud AMD využívá pro své procesory pro řízení provozních parametrů primárně generický ovladač CPUFreq. To se minimálně pro nejnovější generaci serverových EPYCů „Turin“ změní, AMD je převede na vlastní ovladač P-State, a to již v Linuxu 6.13.
articles.title: Počínaje jádrem Linux 6.13 budou CPU EPYC 9005 využívat ovladač AMD P-State

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V tichosti v rámci vydání vývojové verze jádra Linux 6.12-rc4 přibyl i patch odstraňující z jádra několik správců ovladačů a subsystémů. Soubor MAINTAINERS zchudl o jména, která nesplňují potřebné podmínky, informuje Greg Kroah-Hartman, mohou se však v budoucnu vrátit.
articles.title: Několik správců jaderných ovladačů bylo odejito kvůli vazbám na Rusko

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nadace Raspberry Pi uvedla na trh řadu SSD disků NVMe s označením Raspberry Pi. Jsou k dispozici jak samostatně, tak v sadě s M.2 HAT+ jako hotové sady SSD.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi má vlastní SSD disky a sady s M.2 HAT+

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Většina počítačových programů generuje logy – tedy zprávy a záznamy o své činnosti. ELK Stack – ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana – je populární nástroj, který umí logy efektivně zpracovávat, ukládat a zpřístupňovat.
articles.title: ELK Stack: naučte se Elasticsearch, Logstash a Kibana (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 3.4.0 kryptografické knihovny OpenSSL. Novinkou je podpora složených podpisových algoritmů, jako je RSA-SHA2–256, včetně nových funkcí API. Dále je k dispozici podpora indikátorů FIPS pro budoucí validace FIPS 140–3, volitelný dodatečný zdroj náhodných dat RNG JITTER a nové volby -not_before a -not_after pro explicitní nastavení počátečního a konečného data certifikátů.
articles.title: OpenSSL 3.4 přináší autorizační certifikáty dle RFC 5755

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Tvůrci projektu AlmaLinux představili novou verzi, číselně i téměř vším ostatním odpovídající CentOS Stream 10. AlmaLinux Kitten 10 tak představuje systém, který nevyvíjí Red Hat, ale bude zhruba odpovídat jednoho dne vydanému Red Hat Enterprise Linuxu 10.
articles.title: AlmaLinux OS Kitten 10 založený na CentOS 10

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové vydání výpočetního balíku od Intelu opravuje fungování API OpenCL na aktuálně nových mobilních procesorech Intel rodiny Lunar Lake (řeší například hlášené výkonnostní problémy). Vývojáři Intelu také zapracovali na výkonnostních optimalizacích pro nejnovější (i)GPU generaci Xe2 z Lunar Lake a budoucích (snad už opravdu na spadnutí) grafických karet rodiny Battlemage.
articles.title: Intel Compute Runtime 24.39.31294.12 opravuje OpenCL pro Lunar Lake

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 43/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rezonátory prodlužují životnost qubitů v kvantových počítačích. Umělá inteligence se snaží porozumět štěkotu psů. Temelín testuje brýle s rozšířenou realitou.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: I Nobelova cena za chemii je vlastně za umělou inteligenci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Taktik roste. Western Digital dodává pevné disky ePMR s nejvyšší kapacitou na světě. V IT dochází ke slučování rolí, mzdy ale stagnují. HP Scan AI Enhanced umožňuje digitalizaci pracovních postupů. TSMC plánuje další závody v Evropě, ve hře je i Česko. Umělá inteligence bude v roce 2030 vytvářet 3,5 % globálního HDP.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: TSMC plánuje další závody v Evropě, ve hře je i Česko

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 42/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Robotický lovec s umělou inteligencí ochrání kritickou infrastrukturu před útoky dronů . Antihmota v kosmickém záření znovu otevírá otázku temné hmoty v podobě části WIMP. Asteroid, který vyhubil dinosaury, mohl současně odstartovat zemědělství mravenců.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Sonda Psyche opět posunula rekord v laserové komunikaci

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Máme říjen a ti, kdo se připravují sestavit nový počítač, budou mít příležitost vyhradit si větší rozpočet na hardwarové součásti, nebo přidat nějaké další licence, které napřed u Goodoffer24.com zavrhli, a to díky mohutnám slevám nabízeným oproti oficiálnímu ceníku.
articles.title: Výprodej u Goodoffer24 na Halloween představuje Windows 11 Pro za €20 a mnoho dalších slev

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled zářijových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za září 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Soukromé cloudy by mohla čekat nová vlna zájmu. Průzkum Acronis: požadavky NIS 2 nyní splňuje jen 8 % českých firem. DC pro kvantové počítače IBM ve Frankfurtu. Nobelovu cenu za fyziku získali John Hopfield a Geoffrey Hinton – za umělou inteligenci. Průzkum HP ukazuje, jak Češi využívají domácí tiskárny. Pure Storage inovuje souborové služby.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Soukromé cloudy by mohla čekat nová vlna zájmu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 41/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Oxidy uhlíku na Uranově měsíci Ariel naznačují další důkaz pro podpovrchový oceán. Sovy jsou chytřejší než skřivani. Objevili planetu obíhající kolem hvězdy nejbližší našemu Slunci. Jaderná fakulta ČVUT získala simulátor korejského reaktoru pro elektrárnu Dukovany II.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Jak vznikají polární záře a jak o ně nepřijít?

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Na nejmodernější ERP systém Helios Nephrite již přešla téměř tisícovka firem. Vločky jodidu nikelnatého díky magnetoelektrické vazbě slibují úžasné paměti. HP mění budoucnost práce. Tržby z bezpečnostního hardwaru příliš nerostly. Hybridní cloudové platformy novým paradigmatem plateb.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Tržby z bezpečnostního hardwaru příliš nerostly

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Rakudo (Wikipedie), tj. překladač programovacího jazyka Raku (Wikipedie), byl vydán ve verzi #177 (2024.10). Programovací jazyk Raku byl dříve znám pod názvem Perl 6.
articles.title: Rakudo #177 (2024.10)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 7.0 webového prohlížeče Vivaldi (Wikipedie). Postavena je na Chromiu 130. Přehled novinek i s náhledy v příspěvku na blogu. Vypíchnout je nutno nový konfigurovatelný Dashboard (YouTube). Nově je k dispozici také Snap balíček.
articles.title: Vivaldi 7.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Kali Linux končí s jádry a obrazy pro 32bitovou architekturu i386. Příští verze 2024.4 už pro i386 nebude. Arch Linux se tak rozhodl již v roce 2017. Fedora Linux v roce 2019. Stejně tak Ubuntu. Debian přestal balit Linux pro i386    od verze 6.11.2-1.
articles.title: Kali Linux končí s jádry a obrazy pro 32bitovou architekturu i386

articles.author: atirage21
articles.description: Posledná verzia hry Srdcia (Gnome Hearts) vyšla v roku 2013 vo verzii 0.3.1 a odvtedy postupne vypadáva z jednotlivých repozitárov bez adekvátnej náhrady. Aj takto vyzerá koniec linuxových projektov kvôli nedostatku opensource vývojárov. Pôvodný projekt bol nahratý aj na GitHube. Hra Gnome Hearts podľa vyyojárov Gnome nemôže byť začlenená do sady kartových kariet Aisleriot, nakoľko vyžaduje cpu oponenta oproti pôvodným hrám kartových sád. Ako jedinou voľbou v Linuxe ostal projekt Hearts so zvláštnou grafikou.
articles.title: Kartovú hru Srdcia už nejaký čas si na Linuxe nezahráte

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Národní úřad pro kybernetickou a informační bezpečnost (NÚKIB) upozorňuje na phishingový útok spočívající v zaslání e-mailu s tematikou nastavení služby pro sdílení dat a vzdálené správy společnosti Amazon. Text se taktéž odkazuje na zavedení politiky nulové důvěry (Zero Trust Policy). Příloha s různými názvy, vždy však ve formátu .rdp (Remote Desktop Protocol), vede uživatele skrze dialogové okno ke spuštění vzdálené správy mezi jeho zařízením a infrastrukturou útočníka. Podrobně v pdf.
articles.title: NÚKIB upozorňuje na phishingový útok

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na blogu Raspberry Pi byla představena rozšiřující deska Raspberry Pi AI HAT+. Ukázka využití na YouTube.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Ministr školství Mikuláš Bek společně s ředitelem Centra pro zjišťování výsledků vzdělávání (Cermat) Miroslavem Krejčím dnes informovali o personálních změnách ve vedení organizace. Ředitel Krejčí rezignoval na funkci ředitele Cermatu k 31. 10. 2024 a bude dál spolupracovat s MŠMT na přípravě digitalizace klíčových agend a dalším rozvoji systému DiPSy. Dočasným vedením Cermatu bude pověřena zástupkyně ředitele Barbora Rosůlková, která zajistí kontinuitu činnosti organizace.
articles.title: Rezignace ředitele Cermatu Miroslava Krejčího

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Ve středu 13. listopadu 2024 od 16 hodin proběhne SUSE Czech Open House 2024 aneb den otevřených dveří pražské pobočky SUSE. Vyslechnout si lze několik krátkých přednášek, zúčastnit se komentované prohlídky kanceláří a serverovny, popovídat si s členy různých týmů a také probrat pracovní příležitosti.
articles.title: SUSE Czech Open House 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nejnovější číslo časopisu MagPi od nakladatelství Raspberry Pi zdarma ke čtení: MagPi 146 (pdf).
articles.title: MagPi 146

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Několik ruských vývojářů ztratilo status správce Linuxu. Greg Kroah-Hartman odstranil jejich jména ze souboru MAINTAINERS. V rámci diskuze Linus Torvalds odstranění potvrdil a jelikož není právník nezabíhal do podrobností.
articles.title: Několik ruských vývojářů ztratilo status správce Linuxu

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linus Torvalds took to some coding himself today to fix a user-address masking non-canonical speculation issue. The Linux kernel needed an adaptation for this "Meltdown Lite" issue due to different behavior with the latest AMD Zen 5 processors...
articles.title: Linux Adjusts "Meltdown Lite" Mitigation Handling On Newer Zen 5 CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yesterday for the Intel Core Ultra 200S Arrow Lake launch date was my extensive look at the Core Ultra 9 285K under Ubuntu Linux for that 24-core desktop processor. Under focus today is the lower-tier Intel Core Ultra 5 245K with a large variety of Linux performance benchmarks for showing how this 14-core processor compares to prior Intel Core CPUs as well as the AMD Ryzen competition atop Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.
articles.title: Intel Core Ultra 5 245K Linux Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A big batch of AMDGPU/AMDKFD kernel graphics and compute driver updates were mailed in for DRM-Next ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.13 kernel cycle...
articles.title: AMDGPU Changes Readied For Linux 6.13: Runtime Repartitioning, Many Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While last week Qualcomm canceled their Snapdragon X Elite Dev Kit as a $899 USD mini PC built for Windows 11 on ARM and powered by the X1 Elite SoC, the upstreaming Linux support for it is continuing...
articles.title: Linux Support Continues For The Now-Canceled Snapdragon X Elite Dev Kit For Windows

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The newest drm-misc-next pull request was submitted today ahead of the Linux 6.13 merge window opening up in about one month's time...
articles.title: DRM Client Library Code Ready Ahead Of Linux 6.13

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2020~2021 there was lots of talk and work around FUTEX2 for improving the Linux kernel's Futex implementation for fast user mutex. The FUTEX2 work was driven in large part for helping Steam Play / Wine gaming by better matching the behavior of Microsoft Windows with its WaitForMultipleObjects handling. While the initial code landed back in Linux 5.16, there's been other remaining FUTEX2 features still desired like variable-sized futexes and NUMA-awareness. Finally now we're seeing that work revived...
articles.title: FUTEX2 NUMA & Small Futexes Revived For Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Cloud Hypervisor 42.0 is out as the newest update of this open-source, Rust-based hypervisor that began as an Intel software project but is now developed by a number of different organizations from Arm to Microsoft...
articles.title: Cloud Hypervisor 42 Released With SVE/SVE2 Support For AArch64 Guests

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For the upcoming Linux 6.13 cycle there is Xe2 Ultra Joiner and GPU temperature monitoring support along with initial Xe3 graphics support for integrated form with Panther Lake among the Intel graphics driver changes expected so far. Another batch of the Xe kernel graphics driver changes were submitted today for modern Intel graphics with this upcoming Linux 6.13 cycle...
articles.title: Intel Preps OA Sync, Panther Lake Workaround & Other New Graphics Code For Linux 6.13

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: When a number of Russian Linux developers were removed from their MAINTAINERS file in the Linux kernel, it was described as due to "compliance requirements" but vague in what those requirements entailed. Linus Torvalds then commented on the Russian Linux maintainers being de-listed and made it clear that they were done due to government compliance requirements / legal issues around Russia. Now today some additional light has been shed on those new Linux kernel "compliance requirements"...
articles.title: Some Clarity On The Linux Kernel's "Compliance Requirements" Around Russian Sanctions

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this month Intel announced the Core Ultra 200S "Arrow Lake" processors and today they go on sale. In turn, the review embargo also lifts for these new desktop processors. Up first today on Phoronix is the Intel Core Ultra 9 285K Linux performance review for this flagship 24-core desktop processor.
articles.title: Intel Core Ultra 9 285K "Arrow Lake" Delivers Strong Linux Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For the recently launched AMD EPYC 9005 series "Turin" processors there is good support out-of-the-box running on the likes of Linux 6.8 as found with Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. The one exception is if wanting to engage CPU power monitoring you need a RAPL/PowerCap patch that was just upstreamed in v6.12. But what about using a newer kernel for greater performance in light of all the upstream optimizations to the kernel in general? Here are some Linux 6.8 vs. 6.11 vs. 6.12 kernel benchmarks on a dual AMD EPYC 9755 server...
articles.title: AMD EPYC 9755 Performance On The Linux 6.11 & Linux 6.12 Kernels

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today released the Intel Media Driver 2024Q3 release to provide updated Video Acceleration API (VA-API) support for Linux systems along with an updated oneVPL GPU Runtime...
articles.title: Intel Media Stack Updated With Full Support For Lunar Lake, Initial Battlemage Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Going back to 2016 we've known of NVIDIA beginning to use RISC-V to replace their Falcon micro-controller and other micro-controllers within their graphics processors to using this common open-source ISA. That use has continued to grow and an unofficial estimate now puts it at around one billion RISC-V cores shipping in 2024 NVIDIA chips...
articles.title: NVIDIA Shipping Around One Billion RISC-V Cores In Their 2024 Products

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the launch of the Raspberry Pi AI Kit back during the  summer with up to 13 TOPS performance for AI inference, the Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ was announced today with up to 26 TOPS capabilities...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the ASUS AIPT patch posting this weekend from an Intel Linux engineer that was analyzing my previously-published Lunar Lake results showing rather poor performance on the ASUS Zenbook S 14, the performance has been looking much better. On Monday I posted updated Intel Xe2 graphics results showing strong uplift now that the ASUS Lunar Lake laptop was operating in its standard mode rather than whisper mode. In today's article is data from more than 400 CPU/system benchmarks to see how the Core Ultra 7 256V performance has improved with this new Linux kernel patch and compared to the prior AMD Ryzen and Intel Core laptop comparison data.
articles.title: Intel Core Ultra 7 "Lunar Lake" Performance Up By ~22% With ASUS Linux Fix

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following yesterday's news first featured on Phoronix of several Linux driver maintainers being de-listed from their maintainer positions within the mainline Linux kernel over their connections to Russia, Linus Torvalds has today commented on the matter...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: More than a decade ago the DTrace tracing framework from Sun Microsystems was one of the long sought features from Solaris desired by Linux developers. Oracle ended up porting DTrace to Linux over the years but without too much fanfare outside of Oracle Linux especially since the advent of (e)BPF on Linux and other tracing/debugging open-source advancements. With the recent DTrace 2.0, it's now built atop the BPF engine and other upstream kernel tracing features on Linux. Gentoo Linux today announced their support for DTrace 2.0...
articles.title: Gentoo Linux Touts DTrace 2.0 Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google engineer Eric Biggers has worked on some very nice performance optimizations for the crypto code within the Linux kernel such as faster AES-GCM for Intel and AMD CPUs, much faster AES-XTS disk/file encryption with modern CPUs, and many other optimizations over the years. His latest work is on enhancing the CRC32C crypto performance for x86/x86_64 processors...
articles.title: Significant CRC32C Throughput Optimization On The Way To The Linux Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It was just earlier this week that AMD posted Linux patches to switch EPYC over to using the AMD P-State driver rather than the long-used generic ACPI CPUFreq driver. This should lead to better power efficiency out-of-the-box and is a change being made just for EPYC 9005 "Turin" CPUs and future server processors. Already it's looking like this change will be introduced for the upcoming Linux 6.13 merge window...
articles.title: Linux 6.13 To Default To AMD P-State Driver For EPYC 9005 CPUs

Since the end of last year they've been talking up their successes using OpenBMC and now as we approach two years of their OpenBMC use within production, they continue singing the praise of this open-source, Linux-based BMC software stack...

articles.author: Elliott Gatica
articles.description:
Xaku Prime, the next Prime to be added to the ever-growing list in Warframe, will be playable much sooner than expected. As we ramp up for 1999, we have one more to get before its launch.


That being said, since we know Xaku Prime is coming out, what is coming alongside them, and what other tidbits of information should you know?


When does Xaku Prime release in Warframe?


Xaku Prime will be released on November 13, 2024. They will be obtainable in-game via the Relic system, by purchasing parts from other players who farmed, or by buying Prime Access.


If you want to obtain Xaku Prime right away but don’t want to buy Prime Access, start stocking up on Platinum now so you can trade it with others who obtain the parts on day one. Just note that prices will be inflated!


Crafting components will not be known until release day, so check back once we know more.


Image via Digital Extremes


What weapons will come with Xaku Prime?


Xaku Prime’s weapons will be the Quassus Prime and Trumna Prime.


The Quassus Prime may rival the power of the meta Gunsen Prime. Its base version already sports very strong critical stats with decent status. In terms of where it currently is in the meta, it’s already up there alongside other Prime melee weapons. The new stats the Prime variant will have is to be determined.


As for the Trumna Prime, we already know it will be a beast of an explosive LMG. Since it has strong stats overall with innate Heat damage, the Prime is only going to increase all that even further, defining power creep.


Xaku Prime cosmetics


If you purchase the Prime Accessories version of the Xaku Prime Access, you’ll get the Artifex Prime Syandana and Necra Prime Operator suit. These can only be obtained by purchasing the pack; they cannot be obtained via farming in-game.


Along with buying this pack, you’ll also get a 90-day affinity and resource booster.

The post Warframe: Xaku Prime release date, Prime weapons, and more appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Warframe: Xaku Prime release date, Prime weapons, and more

Honey, wake up. A new update just dropped for the PC version of Killer7. But this isn’t just housekeeping, it actually makes some substantial quality-of-life improvements.

The port was decent. More than just a lazy transplant, it allowed the graphics to run in higher resolutions and widescreen. There were some drawbacks, however.


One of the biggest issues has now been addressed: the FMV cutscenes have been remastered based on the GameCube originals. Previously, they were jarringly compressed. You’d go from the clean cell-shade visuals to anime that looks like it was taken from 2006’s YouTube…

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
If you, like me, have spotted the #MCAA hashtag popping up on Twitter and TikTok, you likely weren't able to guess it refers to Minecraft's very own college football league. The MCAA name is a spoof of the NCAA acronym, so it stands for Minecraft Collegiate Athletic Association.


Now, the thing is, MCAA isn't a real football league. It's a new trend where Minecraft players use the game's tools to create or spoof teams, games, and hilarious college football highlights.




So, instead of actual teams like Old Miss or Virginia Tech, you have teams such as the Ole Moo and Pig State, which, let's be honest, could very well pass for real team names. As most of these teams are named after animals, their fanbase and players also tend to be composed of said animal.




The MCAA has Minecraft players creating their own matches and leagues that they'll then post on TikTok. This has, unsurprisingly, already spawned very serious and important drama that spread to other parts of everyday life:




And the drama happens on and off the pitch. If we're to take this random guy on Twitter as a veritable source, some of these teams have stadiums that cost over ten billion dollars.




Which naturally has caused some fans to accuse them of serious fraud:




But scandals about fake money spent on fake teams aside, there's a lot of artistry behind the meme. Check out these absolutely amazing MCAA stadiums to see who you should be rooting for this season:




The MCAA is hilarious if you care about both Minecraft and football, and it feels like a total inevitability. Minecraft's sandbox tools lend players all the assets they need to shape the game in whatever hilarious way they want.


Sadly, Minecraft will ditch VR at the start of 2025, but the game will likely never die as fans show no shortage of new ideas to keep bringing it to the limelight.

The post What is the MCAA? Minecraft College Football teams and viral memes appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What is the MCAA? Minecraft College Football teams and viral memes

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Those brave enough to conquer Zombies' higher rounds will likely come across a few interesting items. One, in particular, is the Loot Key, an object that varies in colors. So, if you are wondering what it does, here's everything you need to know about Loot Keys in Black Ops 6 Zombies.


How to use Loot Keys in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies


Loot Keys drop from various Elite zombies, including Manglers, Abominations, and Amalgams. If you're on Terminus, you can use it to open the Armory, while Liberty Falls' version unlocks the Bank Vault. The Terminus route is the simplest: all you have to do is go to the Armory at the F4 coordinates and use the key from there.


Image by Destructoid


The Loot Key for the Bank Vault proves to be much more challenging, as it also requires a specific combination. You'll have to find three combinations around the map, stationed around the vault, Olly's Comics, and Liberty Lanes. If you need help finding these numbers, check out our full explainer on how to open the Bank Vault in BO6 Zombies.


Whether you're on Liberty Falls or Terminus, you'll notice that each key shows various colors. This appearance ties into the reward's rarity type, starting from Uncommon (green) to the high-valued Legendary (gold). Legendary offers the most beneficial rewards, often giving you a weapon with a rare type of the same name. However, the Uncommon types still prove their worth by giving you some essential items, like equipment and Essence.


To improve your chances of unlocking the Loot Key's Legendary rewards, you must defeat more Elite zombies. Try to survive as long as possible to uncover the rarer keys. You can also save and quit if you're a solo player to keep this gear intact. Then, return to this match later to utilize this equipment again. Squad teams may also use the save and quit, as long as the Host is still active. Otherwise, you can Exfil to end the round and claim some XP.

The post What to do with Loot Keys in Black Ops 6 Zombies (BO6) appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What to do with Loot Keys in Black Ops 6 Zombies (BO6)
